ice elemental.description: The ice elemental is an amorphous conglomeration of ice and snow that writhes and moves about with a mind of its own.  The intense cold generated by the ice elemental is nearly unbearable.

massive troll king.name: massive troll king
massive troll king.description: Massive troll kings are the largest, ugliest, dumbest, and most powerful creatures in the troll family.

soul golem.name: soul golem
soul golem.description: These creatures appear to be immune to all forms of normal damage from sorcery, health-damaging spells (like Harm and Pain), all elemental sources of damage, and all curses. Furthermore, they are puncture-resistant and cannot be kneecapped with Cheap Shots. Holy spells and holy effects (such as holy water flares, Voln-based holy damage abilities, and various cleric secondary effects) still damage them.

direbear.name: direbear
direbear.description: Given their ability to stack roundtime, especially through the use of roars (which can inflict up to 20 seconds of roundtime) and bearhugs (which can inflict 30 seconds of roundtime and leave the target on the ground), extreme caution should be taken around direbears. Even if the bears themselves were not deadly (which they are), one does not want to be on the ground in roundtime when a warped tree spirit wanders in, looking to cast Earthen Fury (917).

fire sprite.name: fire sprite
fire sprite.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

grifflet.name: grifflet
grifflet.description: Grifflets, being a flying creature, are sometimes out of reach for melee attacks, predominantly when they have just soared into a room (though they also sometimes use it as a form of retreat).

shan shaman.name: shan shaman
shan shaman.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

emaciated hierophant.name: emaciated hierophant
emaciated hierophant.description: Hierophants, though ranger-style semis, are highly susceptible to Dark Catalyst (719). This spell is normally only moderately effective against semis.

red tsark.name: red tsark
red tsark.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

supple ivasian inciter.name: supple Ivasian inciter
supple ivasian inciter.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

shan rogue.name: shan rogue
shan rogue.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

illoke shaman.name: Illoke shaman
illoke shaman.description: Illoke shaman have a maneuver attack when knocked prone via certain methods (regular attack to the legs, many spells, some maneuvers) that has a great chance of hurting a like leveled adventurer, especially a pure. It is recommended that shaman be knocked prone before they are killed to maximize safety. Effective ways to prone a shaman include sweep, tangle weed, lullabye, hamstring, tackle, e-wave, and unbalance. If killed while sitting this falling maneuver is still activated.

monstrous direwolf.name: monstrous direwolf
monstrous direwolf.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

muscular supplicant.name: muscular supplicant
muscular supplicant.description: Like other creatures that use two-handed weapons, removing an arm will remove them from being a threat.

yeti.name: yeti
yeti.description:
Hunters familiar with the tactics of glacial morphs will find yeti very familiar. They do employ some maneuver attacks similar to bearhugs and one that is similar to Hurl Boulder (510), but all in all, are the least dangerous creatures found in the Griffin's Keen, if proper care is taken.
Yetis can be stunned, knock them down with Unbalance or hit them in the leg with Limb Disruption. Get them stunned and down on the ground. They have no ability to break stuns.

warped tree spirit.name: warped tree spirit
warped tree spirit.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

athletic dark-eyed incubus.name: athletic dark-eyed incubus
athletic dark-eyed incubus.description: Incubi will heal themselves over time, much like trolls.  Disablers such as Web (118) or Empathy (1108) as openers are helpful as incubi cannot be stunned.

lesser griffin.name: lesser griffin
lesser griffin.description: Lesser griffins, being a flying creature, are sometimes out of reach for melee attacks, predominantly when they have just soared into a room (though they also sometimes use it as a form of retreat).

hunch-backed dogmatist.name: hunch-backed dogmatist
hunch-backed dogmatist.description: One method of guaranteeing that a dogmatist will not automatically resurrect themselves is to completely vaporize it (a la Implosion (720)). However, if it is merely instantly killed by the spell, and not completely vaporized, it can still resurrect.

krag yeti.name: krag yeti
krag yeti.description: A towering mound of fur that belies her swift blinding speed, the krag yeti is at home either in the sub-zero wasteland or on rocky mountain tops.  The krag yeti's white fur allows an almost perfect blend with the natural surroundings, enabling the creature to move with uncommon stealth.  Legendary strength and fury make her a formidable opponent for any who would cross her.

seething pestilent vision.name: seething pestilent vision
seething pestilent vision.description: If you are a member of the Order of Voln using Symbol of Disruption, it is recommended to lower their TD to aid in warding them.

fire mage.name: fire mage
fire mage.description: Fire mages cast Earthen Fury (917) which can be especially deadly against pures, and with open rolls can also be lethal against squares. They also cast Weapon Fire (915), Major Elemental Wave (435), and possibly others. Fire sprites tend to be in the same area which can dispel.

krag dweller.name: krag dweller
krag dweller.description: If you can hide they are easily ambushed by waiting for them to sniff and then ambushing. They have a slow roundtime for their level and you can often two-for-one them. They appear to be geared toward the more physical classes, unlike their krag yeti cousins which can be hunted well by all classes.

magna vereri.name: magna vereri
magna vereri.description: Because the magna vereri use tackle frequently, if you have the DS to withstand their claw attack and are casting warding spells, it may be easier to stay prone rather than standing up and risking stuns or RT lock from continuous tackles. If you do stay prone be mindful of the other creatures lurking about.

ilvari sprite.name: Ilvari sprite
ilvari sprite.description: It is best to keep the room pinned to the ground if possible so that the Ilvari cannot pull pranks by going invisible. Avoid the writhing dreamvines and keep an eye on your stance not being forced down or objects becoming bananas. There are various ways to be knocked down and the Ilvari pixies like to jump out of invisibility with melee attacks. The sprites and the pixies both cast dispel magics, and the pixies will cast Major Elemental Wave (435) sometimes.

storm griffin.name: storm griffin
storm griffin.description: Storm griffins, being a flying creature, are sometimes out of reach for melee attacks, predominantly when they have just soared into a room (though they also sometimes use it as a form of retreat).

ilvari pixie.name: Ilvari pixie
ilvari pixie.description: Grasp of the Grave (709) is useful for keeping the Ilvari knocked down, which prevents them from disappearing and pranking you. You should put danger colors on the writhing dreamvines, their knock down will keep stacking more RT. The Ilvari will cast dispel, and can block magic. Watch out for your runestaff or weapon being turned into a banana, you will have to "open" the banana incurring several seconds of RT. Keep your containers closed or they will fill them with heavy stones to weigh you down. There are a variety of ways to have your stance forced down or made prone to attack.

lesser minotaur.name: lesser minotaur
lesser minotaur.description: Lesser minotaurs have a strong resistance to combat maneuvers, similar to krag dwellers. They can use the mstrike ability for three simultaneous swings of their greataxes. They have the ability to release an AS boosting battle cry similar to a massive troll king frothing or shan warrior yipping. Like other minotaurs they have a deadly charge maneuver, however they use it infrequently.

greater vruul.name: greater vruul
greater vruul.description: The greater vruul has tough, leathery hide, as black as midnight.  Bat-like wings sprout from its back, but they do not look large or strong enough to support its weight in flight.  The vruul's claws are long, sharp and appear to be stained with the blood of many victims.  Its eyes are eerie, solid green orbs that seem to glow with an inner power.

moulis.name: moulis
moulis.description: Moulis are generally a fairly easy enemy to fight. They are fairly average melee users who possess a handful of Wizard spells which they use on a somewhat frequent basis, some warding, some bolt.

naisirc.name: naisirc
naisirc.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

minotaur warrior.name: minotaur warrior
minotaur warrior.description: Minotaur warriors have the ability to MSTRIKE.  They have a particularly dangerous charge maneuver, and they also have the ability to use the disarm maneuver, so hunt them with caution. Minotaur warriors do not stun by normal means.

shrickhen.name: shrickhen
shrickhen.description: The Shrickhen are easily the most dangerous of the enemies in the Labyrinth, almost certainly because they regularly use and cast Elemental Wave (410) and Major Elemental Wave (435). Furthermore, they tend to spawn with these spells active, so upon initially entering the Labyrinth, or after killing several Shrickhen in a short period of time, caution should be exercised when engaging the newly spawned Shrickhen. Because of this, it is of the utmost importance to prevent casting by a Shricken; unlike the Dhu Goleras, who with more than a dozen spells, may cast something less dangerous, the Shricken has a very high chance of casting these two spells.

farlook.name: farlook
farlook.description: Torrents of spiritual magic dance around the farlook in a vivid display of black and white wisps.  A soft liquid membrane is covered with a thickened skin that covers three-fourths of sphere-shape.  A large,  iris takes up the remaining quarter, which can be protected by a folded layer of skin just just above it.  A sick goo constantly drips from the severed nerve ending jutting out of the back of the farlook.  Crimson energy ripples emanate from the bottom of the farlook, causing it to bob up and down a few inches off the ground.

raving lunatic.name: raving lunatic
raving lunatic.description: Raving lunatics are physical combatants, knowing no magic and having only a small natural reserve of mana. They attack exceptionally quickly with their critical-weighted daggers which they will also throw at random intervals. They can be exceedingly dangerous with either feras or drake weapons, or if an adventurer has been put into a bad position by another creature.

dhu goleras.name: dhu goleras
dhu goleras.description: Dhu goleras are melee-capable pures which spend about half of their time using CS-based spiritual/sorcerer spells and the other half using average melee attacks. They cast frequently, and many of their spells, such as Dark Catalyst (719) and the itchy Curse (715) can be extremely dangerous even on minor endrolls. With this in mind, preventing casting through the use of Silence (210), Corrupt Essence (703), stuns, or disabling maneuvers is a must. They have a very wide array of spells, so expect anything if they manage to cast a spell. They have no maneuvers to speak of other than spells such as Quake (709) and Energy Maelstrom (710). Their CS is fairly high, so even against a like leveled, fully spelled up pure, they may have a small warding margin. They do not spawn with a prepared spell, nor do they prepare spells while wandering or spell themselves up. However, their TD is relatively high compared to the other denizens of the Labyrinth. If their casting can be prevented, they offer little risk on their own.

minotaur magi.name: minotaur magi
minotaur magi.description: The minotaur magus is an ugly, brutish looking beast.  Taller than most average men, the minotaur has a bull-like appearance while his muscular body is humanoid with thick arms and broad shoulders.  The minotaur magi feet end in hooves that rattle the ground with every step.  Despite his barbaric features, a great intelligence is reflected in the depths of his eyes and mannerisms.

seraceris.name: seraceris
seraceris.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

treekin warrior.name: treekin warrior
treekin warrior.description: Treekin warriors do not stun and are quite difficult to knock down. Severing a single leg will not knock them over, and they can stand back up even with both legs severed. They are immune to Grasp of the Grave (709). Sorcerers can hunt them safely using Pain (711) to keep them in RT lock, but the treekin druids are several levels higher, have barkskin and maneuvers, and buff their TD with defensive spells. The treekin saplings can be several levels lower than the warriors but have a knockdown ability that can be lethal in combination with the treekin warrior groan DS pushdown. Elemental Wave (410) affects them but requires significant Minor Elemental spell ranks at like level to be useful. Treekin will get knocked down, stunned, and RT locked for Evil Eye (717), which can be mass cast (including remotely) using a demon carrying an eye with catch/release alias.

vvrael witch.name: Vvrael witch
vvrael witch.description: Like all Vvrael family creatures, the witches are immune to magic.

csetairi.name: csetairi
csetairi.description: Csetairi are capable of dispelling a large number of spells at once:

greater skayl.name: greater skayl
greater skayl.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

caedera.name: caedera
caedera.description: Caederas can move between rooms by burrowing, which can knock down targets who fail a maneuver check and inflict up to 20 seconds of roundtime.

earth elemental.name: earth elemental
earth elemental.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

gnarled being.name: gnarled being
gnarled being.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

bent being.name: bent being
bent being.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

stooped being.name: stooped being
stooped being.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

twisted being.name: twisted being
twisted being.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

lesser construct.name: lesser construct
lesser construct.description: Constructs are surrounded by a golden aura which will absorb approximately 200hp in damage before disappearing. Spells cast against them will have no effect until the shield is removed. Physical attacks can harm the construct and the shield, so it is possible to remove the shield with melee attacks and finish with spells.

treekin druid.name: treekin druid
treekin druid.description: Treekin druids are difficult to knock down. Severing a single leg will not knock them over, and they can stand back up even with both legs severed. They are immune to Grasp of the Grave (709) and will dig their roots into the ground and not stun for open cast Implosion (720). They walk away from focused Energy Maelstrom (710). Sorcerers can solo hunt them relatively safely by using the Hex Curse (715) to push their target defense (TD) down, Corrupt Essence (703) to block their spell casting and break their barkskin with its own TD pushdown, and then Pain (711) to prevent their leaves and pollen maneuvers. Evil Eye (717) is effective for knocking down treekin and locking them into lengthy RT, and a demon carrying an eye can be used to suppress rooms or set them up remotely. Elemental Wave (410) will only be useful at like level with considerable Minor Elemental training.

greater krynch.name: greater krynch
greater krynch.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

gremlock.name: gremlock
gremlock.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

lich qyn'arj.name: lich qyn'arj
lich qyn'arj.description: The qyn'arj is a creature of legend, a massive serpent held aloft on brightly colored wings.  But the lich qyn'arj before you has been animated by some means.  The qyn'arj's body seems to hover there without the need to beat its rotting and mottled wings.  Decaying flesh covers its body, but the head is completely skeletal and polished to the fine white of bleached bone.  Swirling red pinpoints float where eyes used to be, and dagger sharp teeth can be seen inside its maw.

steam dervish.name: steam dervish
steam dervish.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

vvrael warlock.name: Vvrael warlock
vvrael warlock.description: The Vvrael warlocks are anti-magical creatures who feed on mana, making them immune to both spells and indirect spell effects.

firebird.name: firebird
firebird.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

illoke elder.name: Illoke elder
illoke elder.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

aivren.name: aivren
aivren.description: Aivren are the only thing normally on Plane 3 that can be Sacrificed for mana, which is easily set up with two casts of Pain (711) and one cast of Mana Disruption (702), possibly with an additional Mind Jolt (706). They cannot tend themselves and carry no treasure, so they will eventually bleed out and can be used as blood batteries for Blood Burst (701). Their swats will push your stance down if you do not pay attention.

festering taint.name: festering taint
festering taint.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

n'ecare.name: n'ecare
n'ecare.description: On Plane 3 the n'ecare are mostly a threat for knocking you down with RT, followed by their AS boost or Vvrael warlock guiding force such as when casting Balefire (713). The aivren swatting maneuver can also force your stance down to neutral or even offensive with an RT lock, which all together can quickly become deadly. It is best to not hunt them with multiple creatures left standing for this reason. The aivren are flying monsters.

ash guardian.name: ash guardian
ash guardian.description: Should be dealt with before killing any blazing red phoenixes in the same room. The Guardian will protect the phoenix allowing it to perform its rebirth more easily.

greater earth elemental.name: greater earth elemental
greater earth elemental.description: Greater earth elementals have DFRedux which will reduce the damage factors of weapons, including bolt spells, by 30% for AS-based attacks. This is in addition to their natural full plate equivalent armor.

illoke jarl.name: Illoke jarl
illoke jarl.description: Jarls, along with most other stone creatures, should be on the ground before landing the killing blow.

ithzir scout.name: Ithzir scout
ithzir scout.description: The scouts will throw their broadswords sometimes instead of swinging them.

blazing red phoenix.name: blazing red phoenix
blazing red phoenix.description: Will attempt a rebirth maneuver, resurrecting itself when killed. The chance to successfully perform this is increased substantially if there is a living Ash Guardian in the room.

ithzir initiate.name: Ithzir initiate
ithzir initiate.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

lost soul.name: lost soul
lost soul.description: Lost souls have relatively low health. They are non-corporeal undead, but their corpses do not decay quickly like most non-corporeal. They can be easily killed with front-loaded damage abilities (e.g., multi-strike).

ithzir janissary.name: Ithzir janissary
ithzir janissary.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

water elemental.name: water elemental
water elemental.description: The water elemental's upper body is that of a humanoid, while its lower body forms a turbulent, watery vortex. The facial features of the elemental creature are vague and shifting, rippling with every contortion of its face. Sloshing and splashing noises accompany each movement of the water elemental, along with an odd gurgling.

ithzir herald.name: Ithzir herald
ithzir herald.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

vaespilon.name: vaespilon
vaespilon.description: Vulnerable to fire (symbol of holiness works wonders).  Vaespilon are quick and will cast Implosion, which on particularly bad rolls can instantly vaporize the victim and cause the remains to rain down in the middle of Icemule Trace.  As such, avoid letting them cast spells at all costs. They will not spawn with a spell already prepped but it is very possible to walk into a room where they have prepped a spell after seeing another adventurer.

triton dissembler.name: triton dissembler
triton dissembler.description: Weight carefully balanced upon her massive tail, the triton dissembler walks rigidly upright, moving with self-absorbed elegance. Luminous dark blue eyes are set deeply in the sockets of her fine-boned head where delicate, fleshy lips curve into an unpleasant smile. The dissembler's long, translucently webbed hands bear curved claws, carefully filed to tapered points and painted with gold lacquer. This pretense to arrogant refinement belies the feverishly clammy sweat covering the creature's slick, sea green hide.

triton warlock.name: triton warlock
triton warlock.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

huge air elemental.name: huge air elemental
huge air elemental.description: The air elemental is a vaguely humanoid whirlwind of unusually dense air.  Its constant spin is almost hypnotic, though it radiates a palpable disdain for all solid life.

huge earth elemental.name: huge earth elemental
huge earth elemental.description: Massive and thick, with broad shoulders but no apparent head, the earth elemental appears to be a composite of the earth itself.  A large, craggy maw in the middle of the elemental's chest appears to be the creature's mouth, and the earth elemental's huge feet and giant-sized fists look like they would pulverize flesh without much effort at all.

huge ice elemental.name: huge ice elemental
huge ice elemental.description: The ice elemental is an amorphous conglomeration of ice and snow that writhes and moves about with a mind of its own.  The intense cold generated by the ice elemental is nearly unbearable.

huge water elemental.name: huge water elemental
huge water elemental.description: The water elemental's upper body is that of a humanoid, while its lower body forms a turbulent, watery vortex.  The facial features of the elemental creature are vague and shifting, rippling with every contortion of its face.  Sloshing and splashing noises accompany each movement of the water elemental, along with an odd gurgling.

ithzir adept.name: Ithzir adept
ithzir adept.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

lithe veiled sentinel.name: lithe veiled sentinel
lithe veiled sentinel.description: Lithe veiled sentinels are monks. When engaging in combat cut off their heads or disable them as they are highly susceptible to ambush. You should also prioritize them based on their Unholy Quickening maneuver. If you do happen to get targeted by this you can try and CLENCH the snake type to combat it.

siren.name: siren
siren.description: The siren is a peculiar vision of beauty from the sea.  Though her lower body is that of an iridescently scaled fish, it takes away nothing from the rest of her ravishingly feminine figure draped in long, golden blonde hair and surrounded by a mystical aura.  Discretely hidden webbing beneath her arms that aids in navigating deep waters has given rise to the erroneous legend that the siren can also fly.  The soothing song from these strangely beautiful creatures has pulled many sailors to their deaths, and every moment that the siren gazes at you with her captivating brilliant blue eyes and serenades you with liquid notes from her glistening full lips is a moment that you plunge deeper into danger yourself.

triton assassin.name: triton assassin
triton assassin.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

triton executioner.name: triton executioner
triton executioner.description: The triton executioner scans his surroundings with merciless eyes as if seeking his next client.  Heavy, leathery lips are pulled into a perpetually disgusted sneer, pinching the creature's nostrils into narrow slits.  Animal muscles, powerfully knotted beneath his moist blue-green skin, seem ready to spring in any direction.  The executioner wears a dark blue tabard emblazoned with a silver wave upon the chest.

fallen crusader.name: fallen crusader
fallen crusader.description: Fallen crusaders can regenerate and heal themselves, similar to trolls:

ithzir seer.name: Ithzir seer
ithzir seer.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

patchwork flesh monstrosity.name: patchwork flesh monstrosity
patchwork flesh monstrosity.description: A patchwork flesh monstrosity is near as tall as a giant and twice as broad, a lumbering monstrosity cobbled together from spare parts in tactless parody of a human form.  Red-tinged serum leaks constantly from the straining stitches that maintain the monster's integrity.  Only the barest glimmer of intelligence lurks in the monstrosity's eyes, and that, perhaps, is a blessing: anything with even half of a brain would be horrified to be such an abominable figure.  From the looks of it, the monstrosity's has barely a quarter of one.

shambling lurk.name: shambling lurk
shambling lurk.description: Not dead so long that its body has begun to lose the unwinnable war against decay, a shambling lurk is firmly in the grip of rigor mortis.  Its face is paralyzed in a slack-jawed smile that reveals broken teeth and a dry and swollen tongue.  From the viridian firelight dancing in its eyes, it is clear that it is beyond the services of a cleric, except perhaps to grant the blessing of a swift release.

deathsworn fanatic.name: deathsworn fanatic
deathsworn fanatic.description: Clad in emerald robes of lush velvet that are stitched with tiny scales of clacking bronze, the fanatic is nearly fleshless, his reserves of fat and muscle burned away by a long war with madness.  He has, judging from the stink of body odor and filth about him, not washed in weeks, and his gaze is as inconstant as the quickfire succession of random emotions that play across his tanned face.

spectral triton defender.name: spectral triton defender
spectral triton defender.description: The triton defender forges ahead on powerful legs, as if unaware of their lack of substance, while thick and ropey muscles bunch powerfully along her oddly translucent arms.  The skin covering her squat ethereal frame is the color of bleached, dirty leather and seems to retain the clammy wetness of living amphibians.  Sweeping behind her muscled limbs, a long tail floats after the creature like a recently abandoned child.

spectral triton protector.name: spectral triton protector
spectral triton protector.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

triton brawler.name: triton brawler
triton brawler.description: Triton brawlers are monk-style combatants that live on the Atoll near Kraken's Fall. They make a unique and fearsome foe due to their use of the Unarmed Combat System. They can also disarm attackers with their use of the Brace (1214) spell.

triton combatant.name: triton combatant
triton combatant.description: The triton combatant stands hunched, her head thrust forward, and neck enveloped by heavy, muscled shoulders.  Tiny alien eyes stare from a prominently bony brow, regarding the world with stubborn truculence.  A mottled brown ridge rises from the amphibian's forehead and sweeps up and back, hugging her skull.  This heavy protuberance, covered with damp, leathery skin, provides her with formidable head and neck protection.

huge fire elemental.name: huge fire elemental
huge fire elemental.description: The fire elemental is a massing of flames that flow and flicker with a life of their own.  The intense heat generated by the fire elemental is nearly unbearable.

huge steam elemental.name: huge steam elemental
huge steam elemental.description: The steam elemental is a dense cloud of solid steam, occasionally manifesting a mouth or tendrils with which to affect its surroundings.  It constantly expands and contracts, but never loses its unbearably hot aura.

glistening cerebralite.name: glistening cerebralite
glistening cerebralite.description: Glistening cerebralites have a thick shell which protects them from attacks, giving some amount of critical padding.

huge lava elemental.name: huge lava elemental
huge lava elemental.description: The lava elemental is a bubbling mound of lava, across which an occasional warped face appears before dissolving away.  Various appendages form and melt away constantly, as the alien creature goes about its business.

huge lightning elemental.name: huge lightning elemental
huge lightning elemental.description: The lightning elemental is a crackling mass of solidified power, definitely alien to Elanthia.  Nearly gelatinous in substance, solid bolts of lightning weave themselves into the skeletal form of some horrible beast, only to arc in an instant to a vaguely humanoid form and then back again.

triton fanatic.name: triton fanatic
triton fanatic.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

triton radical.name: triton radical
triton radical.description: Glaring angrily and gnashing his sharp yellowed teeth, the triton radical stalks along muttering to himself as if involved in angry debate with a phantasmal antagonist.  Pale, red-rimmed eyes sit deep in a heavy-boned skull, which perches upon a long, slender neck.  The radical's body pitches forward alarmingly, so only the weight of his tail prevents a return to a four-legged posture.  Upon his tapered brow is set a golden crown bearing a large, wave-etched crystal drop.

war griffin.name: war griffin
war griffin.description: War griffins have several creature maneuvers.

heavily armored battle mastodon.name: heavily armored battle mastodon
heavily armored battle mastodon.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

immense gold-bristled hinterboar.name: immense gold-bristled hinterboar
immense gold-bristled hinterboar.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

ithzir champion.name: Ithzir champion
ithzir champion.description: Ithzir champions use warrior maneuvers, don't stun, and hit rather hard. While manageable in a group, things get dicier when the woods start to swarm.

pale scaled shaper.name: pale scaled shaper
pale scaled shaper.description: Shapers spawn with Wall of Force (140) and Cloak of Shadows (712) (with retributive Condemn (309)) active) as well as Soul Ward (319). However, if you can overcome their DS, their lack of armor leaves them vulnerable. They will occasionally cast Major Elemental Wave (435) back-to-back.

triton magus.name: triton magus
triton magus.description: Moving quietly on wide, webbed feet, the triton magus seems to slip between the shadows, her damp mottled flesh shifting colors with the surroundings. The creature pauses frequently, her flared nostrils quivering as if seeking beings as nearly invisible as herself. A long row of tiny needle-sharp teeth protrudes from grey gums, visible behind her curled, wet lips. A loose robe in varying shades of grey and green covers the magus, hanging just below her twitching tail.

triton warden.name: triton warden
triton warden.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

enormous rift crawler.name: enormous rift crawler
enormous rift crawler.description: An enormous rift crawler burrowing when it will later erupt from the ground (sanctify to negate any potential damage):

ethereal triton psionicist.name: ethereal triton psionicist
ethereal triton psionicist.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

ethereal triton sentry.name: ethereal triton sentry
ethereal triton sentry.description: The triton sentry holds himself erect, as he skims along the ground on long-nailed translucent webbed feet. Obsessively alert, the creature sniffs constantly and halts to listen every few moments. Despite empty eye sockets, constantly weeping viscous green mucus, he peers into the shadows for infiltrators, his head constantly turning with rapid, jerky motions. Threadbare green-belted robes cover his insubstantial frame.

stunted halfling bloodspeaker.name: stunted halfling bloodspeaker
stunted halfling bloodspeaker.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

darkly inked fetish master.name: darkly inked fetish master
darkly inked fetish master.description: A darkly inked fetish master can be found in the Scatter in the Rift. This creature is a child-like voodoo witch doctor, drawing upon elaborate inked designs on its skin for its dark powers. The masters cast mostly Sorcerer spells and can summon a cluster of wooden dolls on their current target, who would lay down a barrage of attacks.

niveous giant warg.name: niveous giant warg
niveous giant warg.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

greater water elemental.name: greater water elemental
greater water elemental.description: The water elemental's upper body is that of a humanoid, while its lower body forms a turbulent, watery vortex. The facial features of the elemental creature are vague and shifting, rippling with every contortion of its face. Sloshing and splashing noises accompany each movement of the water elemental, along with an odd gurgling.

savage fork-tongued wendigo.name: savage fork-tongued wendigo
savage fork-tongued wendigo.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

murky soul siphon.name: murky soul siphon
murky soul siphon.description: A murky soul siphon can be found in the Scatter in the Rift. This is an undead entity subsisting upon the souls of the living. Classified as a semi, it uses various debuff spells to set up its foes for easier consumption. Its attacks have a chance to drain spirit and they also make use of a maneuver-based grasp to suck spirit from characters.

quivering sanguine ooze.name: quivering sanguine ooze
quivering sanguine ooze.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

withered shadow-cloaked draugr.name: withered shadow-cloaked draugr
withered shadow-cloaked draugr.description: A shadow-cloaked draugr is a type of corporeal undead creature, approximately level 105-110, found in the Pits of the Dead zone of the Hinterwilds. They are enormous, powerful creatures typically wielding a two-handed greatsword with tremendous strength, but also capable of various maneuver attacks able to damage and knock players prone. They wear decaying leathers that are equivalent to AsG 7 armor (reinforced leather).

vvrael destroyer.name: Vvrael destroyer
vvrael destroyer.description: A Vvrael destroyer can be found in the Scatter in the Rift. This is a greater servant of the Vvrael, sent to dispatch the strongest of their foes. These are warrior type creatures; very powerful and highly destructive.

squamous reptilian mutant.name: squamous reptilian mutant
squamous reptilian mutant.description: This section has not been added yet; please add to it now!

infernal lich.name: infernal lich
infernal lich.description: A Lich can be found in the Scatter in the Rift. This is a highly intelligent spell caster who went to great lengths to gain power and longevity, at the cost of his soul.

frostborne lich.name: frostborne lich
frostborne lich.description: A Lich can be found in the Scatter in the Rift. This is a highly intelligent spell caster who went to great lengths to gain power and longevity, at the cost of his soul.
